instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Green light no image no backlight
threads.message:
HI.

The board had some liquid damage all taken care of also replaced LSDV and now at this state. <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>, <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> no damage on them. Any advice please?

Thanks :cool:

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Green light no image no backlight
threads.message:
No image/backlight means board stays on???
Please describe correctly the state of the board.
We try to help in base of provided information.
YOU are the first interested to provide it.

Do you get VCORE?
What about USB activity, external video?
